Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:
We are searching for an Associate Data Scientist. The Associate Data Scientist harnesses the largest pediatric healthcare dataset in the nation to deliver analytics, insights, and solutions that help us create a healthier future for our global community.
The individual in this role delivers data analytics and support the development and implementation of advanced analytic tools to meet the needs of teams throughout the organization. Works with a multidisciplinary team to design, develop, and create
analytical solutions through applications of data mining, machine learning, artificial intelligence (AI), and emerging technologies. Collaborates with clinical, business, and information systems team members to ideate and create new analytic
solutions impacting patient care and hospital operations. Partners with subject matter experts to understand the relationship between workflows and data, and uses that data to create innovative solutions that support and advance targeted outcomes.
Exercises knowledge of descriptive, predictive, and multivariate statistical techniques and applications, and database analysis tools and techniques, to develop strategic insights to drive operational and clinical goals.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously to meet objectives and deadlines

Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:
Job Description: Data Analyst

Why Guaranteed Rate is the BEST Place to Work

Guaranteed Rate is one of the largest retail mortgage lenders in the United States. Headquartered in Chicago, the Company has 7,500 employees in 400 offices across the U.S., and is licensed in all 50 states and Washington, D.C. Since its founding in 2000, Guaranteed Rate has helped hundreds of thousands of homeowners with home purchase loans and refinances and funded more than $59 billion in loans in 2020 alone. The company has cemented itself as Positively Different by introducing innovative technology, such as the world's first Digital Mortgage, by offering low rates and by delivering unparalleled customer service. Honors and awards include: Top Lender for Online Service for 2018 by U.S. News & World Report; Best Mortgage Lender for Online Loans and Best Mortgage Lender for Refinancing by NerdWallet for 2021; HousingWire’s 2020 Tech100 award for the company’s industry-leading FlashClose SM technology; No. 3 ranking in Scotsman Guide's Top Retail Mortgage Lenders 2019; Chicago Agent Magazine’s Lender of the Year for five consecutive years; Chicago Tribune's Top Workplaces list for seven consecutive years. Visit rate.com for more information.

What Makes Our Team Awesome

We are a gritty group of passionate technologists on a mission to dominate the mortgage world!

The Information Technology Team within Guaranteed Rate passionately and consistently puts our customers first. We are building the latest technology to help create the best mortgage experience on the planet and get your mortgage, your way, anytime, anywhere. Whether that is improving our digital mortgage platform, automating loan coordination and underwriting processes, or building out the latest marketing and customer engagement platform, we’re doing it all. We build high performing, self-organized, cross functional agile teams that operate with minimal hierarchy. Information Technology team members hold self and others accountable and live and breathe the tenets of autonomy, mastery and purpose.

Who You Are

The Data Analyst will have a diverse set of responsibilities supporting the design / build of data platforms that enable revenue generation, operational execution, reporting, strategic analysis and next generation Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning. You will have the opportunity to leverage your data analysis and design skills to help Guaranteed Rate deliver upon the organization’s Data Strategy and Data Management Program. You will work cross-functionally across departments and enhance existing data platforms and build new information infrastructure that helps the business uncover insights, make clear visualizations, tell compelling stories, and drive action and outcomes. The ideal candidate is action-oriented and leverages their experience and academic training to pragmatically tackle complex data problems, including addressing regulatory obligations. The Guaranteed Rate Data Office engages with a diverse array of stakeholders including both business and technology teams. The Data Analyst will deliver data platforms that help the organization realize data-driven decisions and operational optimization.

What You Do

Analyze customer data to develop actionable insights to drive customer behavior and operational efficiencies

Partner with Technology and Data Engineering resources to design, build and implement data platforms in support of analytics, reporting, marketing, operations, etc.

Conduct root-cause data analysis to identify patterns and trends

Explain data anomalies, develop data visualizations and reporting to drive key messaging and recommendations

Deliver data-centric process improvement both individual teams and cross-organization / multi-stakeholder projects

Assists delivering the design, development, and maintenance of databases, data marts and dashboard tools; Orchestrates data quality / integrity improvements for critical data elements

Support strategic projects related to new product deployment and customer-level aggregation deliverables

Support Marketing data extracts, campaign execution including segmentation analysis. Provide observations and business context to deliver meaningful insights to business leads related to campaigns/offers

What Makes You a Perfect Fit

4+ years of progressive professional work experience building data platforms; expertise supporting/executing reporting & analytics, including working in teams of data analytic resources

Experience and a working understanding of data profiling tooling and data analysis methodologies to understand data quality and identify data concerns

Expertise with campaign execution tools and business processes, including data integration and data extraction processes

Advanced understanding and proven experience using data management concepts, data normalization and ETL development

Experienced building presentations with actionable insights

Strong verbal and visual communication skills to present and explain data strategies, data deliverables and data analytic insights

Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

Proven experience with on premise and cloud-based data solutions (SQL Server, Azure, AWS, GCP, Snowflake), data modeling, metadata management, database design/build/implementation/management and data visualization tools/platforms

Sound understanding of data governance concepts

Hands on experience with SQL, Python, or R

Other Useful Details

Employee Type
Full-Time

Pay Range
80,000-100,000+ Bonus and/or Commissions

Location
Remote or Chicago-based

Ariat is looking for a Sr. Data Scientist to join our Strategy and Analytics team supporting day to day customer analytics, logistics analytics, and marketing optimizations. Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:
About The Job
Disney Streaming is the leading premium streaming service offering live and on-demand TV and movies, with and without commercials, both in and outside the home. Operating at the intersection of entertainment and technology, Disney Streaming has a unique opportunity to be the number one choice for TV. We captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love, and we’re looking for people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation, unconventional thinking, and embracing fun. Join us and see what this is all about.
Marketing science – a sub-team within marketing analytics at Disney Streaming Services (Hulu, Disney+, ESPN+ and Star) – is in search of an analyst to run marketing mix models (MMM) and associated ancillary analysis. This position will work as part of a team focused primarily on econometric modeling, which also provides support for downstream practices used to inform marketing investment. The analyst plays a hands-on role in modeling efforts. The ideal candidate has a substantial quantitative skill set with direct experience in marketing science practices (MMM, attribution modeling, testing / experimentation, etc.), and should serve as a strong mentor to analysts, helping to onboard new talent in support of wider company goals. Technical acumen as well as narrative-building are integral to the success of this role.

Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:
Join our innovative and collaborative Digital Transformation and Data team. As a Data Scientist, you’ll influence and help Macquarie produce value with data within our Corporate Operations Group and beyond. You will apply your broad data expertise though a mix coaching others, providing strategic advice, and performing hands-on analysis.

You will be responsible for:
Partnering with business leaders and coaching nascent data teams to uplift data capability
Identifying, determining feasibility, and shaping data use cases
Determining appropriate analytical, statistical or machine learning approaches to create value

Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:
Description
Job Description:
Military and Veterans Health Solutions under the Leidos Health Group is looking for a Data Scientist to support the Warfighter Performance Department at the Naval Health Research Center (NHRC). This work includes collecting and analyzing data during active military training in a variety of locations across the United States as well as international locations. This research addresses the needs and concerns of Special Operations’ Warfighters, as well as Expeditionary Forces, to improve performance, enhance sustainment and mitigate injury. Results are delivered through abstracts, presentations, peer-reviewed journal publications, and government technical reports. The Data Scientist will write funding proposals and participate in all aspects of research protocol execution related to human performance in military operational environments. The Data Scientist will design and develop methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze structured and unstructured, diverse sources including big data sources. The Data Scientist will develop and use advanced software programs, algorithms, querying and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate datasets and models complex business problems. The candidate will work with cross-discipline teams in order to ensure connectivity between various databases and systems. The candidate will identify meaningful insights and interpret and communicate findings and recommendations. The Data Scientist may develop information tools, algorithms, dashboards, and queries to monitor and improve business performance; and maintains awareness of emerging analytics and big-data technologies.
Pay Range $60,450.00 - $93,000.00 - $125,550.00

Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:
At Mars Petcare we have one Purpose: A BETTER WORLD FOR PETS™. Through comprehensive veterinary care, nutrition, breakthrough programmes in diagnostics, wearable health monitoring, DNA testing and pet welfare, we help pets in more than 130 countries.

The Petcare Segment consists of five Divisions: Pet Nutrition, Royal Canin, Mars Veterinary Health, Kinship and Science and Diagnostics. All five Divisions have a shared ambition, to become Powered by Data.
Integrating and analysing the diverse data from across our brands allows us to develop a richer understanding of the pets and pet owners we serve. These insights provide us the opportunity to individualise pet care, create new science and be a force for good. We believe that pets make the world a better place, and every day we strive to create a better world for them.






Find out more about what Mars can offer you by visiting our Global Careers site.

Title: Data Scientist

Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:

Position Purpose:
The Principal Data Scientist is responsible for leading data science initiatives that drive business profitability, increased efficiencies and improved customer experience. This role assists in the development of the Home Depot advanced analytics infrastructure that informs decision making by leveraging mastery of both the business and Advanced Analytics Modeling techniques. Principal Data Scientists focus on seeking out business opportunities to leverage data science as a competitive advantage.


As a Principal Data Scientist, you will lead large data science projects, identifying opportunities to leverage the best technology and approach, and mentoring data scientists on the project team. This role is expected to contribute to Home Depot's intellectual property by developing cutting-edge, innovative algorithms. This role supports the building of skilled and talented data science teams by providing input to staffing needs and participating in the recruiting and hiring process. In addition, this role requires networking with experts, both academic and industry, to further the application of data science to business problems.




This position typically reports to Senior Manager or above
This position has 0 Direct Reports and leads/manages projects



1. Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.

Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.
























$280,000 - $150,000

Title: DevOps Engineer
Job_Description:

As a DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining processes for deploying several large-scale architectures. You will advocate for modern DevSecOps practices and have the opportunity to brief potential clients on DevSecOps culture and technology. In this position, you will utilize tools such as Docker, GitLab, and Ansible to handle the configuration and deployment of software to test and production environments.
DevOps (DevSecOps) is a challenging discipline that seems to be evolving each day. Hellebore has been leading DevOps transformations within the DoD for years and understands the complexities that our clients face. You will automate software engineering practices across multiple teams and projects in this role. Start by ensuring we have solid, foundational processes in place. The design decisions you will make in this position will have a direct and lasting impact on the success of the entire software team and organization.

SMILE DIGITAL HEALTH IS A POWERFUL AND FLEXIBLE PLATFORM
Smile Digital Health is a health technology company that reduces barriers between information and care for those who deliver or consume healthcare services and products and whose roles or care are hindered by fractured inaccessible or complex information systems.

Our clinical data repository is built around the HL7 FHIR standard for storing health records. About this role
Are you interested in applying your signal processing and predictive modeling skills to design next-generation algorithms for cardiac health assessment? Are you a tenacious and self-catalyzing problem solver? If so, this role at Sensydia is for you. As a Data Science Engineer, you’ll work collaboratively with our team of engineers to derive insights from biosensor data collected using Sensydia’s Cardiac Performance System – a device that provides fast and safe cardiac assessment to improve lives of people with compromised heart function.

Branch is on a mission to make insurance less expensive, so more people can be covered. We use data, tech, and automation to simplify insurance from start to finish — cutting out the long, bait-and-switch quotes and unnecessary costs in the traditional insurance process. Then we pass those savings along to our members. The result? Prices in seconds. Hundreds in savings.
But we’re not just changing the way home and auto insurance works. We want to change what it means to “work in insurance,” too. Restoring insurance to its original purpose — a force for communal good. Together, we’re getting back to getting each other’s back. Branch's Operations Team
Our Operations team works to automate our practices, make sure they work, and then make them work even better. Our team members are embedded within departments at Branch to assess our processes and creatively find ways to drive growth, reduce, cost, and delight our members through our commitment to getting insurance back to what it should have always been: a force for communal good. Our Operations team focuses on managing and supporting day-to-day operations of key operations components within Branch: Member Communications, Billing, Policy Services, Licensing & Compliance, Security Permissions, Vendor Management, Project Reviews, and more. About the Operations Analytics and Data Execution Lead role:

Headquartered in New York, the Claims Conference is a global, non-profit organization committed to providing a small measure of justice to Holocaust Survivors. Since our founding in 1951, the Claims Conference has secured more than $90 billion from the German government in indemnification for Survivors. In 2021, the Claims Conference distributed approximately $625 million in direct compensation to over 260,000 survivors in 83 countries and allocated approximately $640 million in grants to over 300 social service agencies worldwide that provide vital services for Holocaust survivors, such as home care, food, and medicine. Our Research, Education, and Documentation (RED) funds contribute toward global efforts to educate the public and preserve the memory of the Holocaust through teacher training programs, exhibitions, and films such as Son of Saul, an Academy Award winner for Best Foreign Film. At the Claims Conference, we honor history while making history.

Title: Operations Analytics and Data Execution Lead
Job_Description:
Why Mayo Clinic
Mayo Clinic is the nation's best hospital (U.S. News & World Report, 2022-2023) and ranked #1 in more specialties than any other care provider. We have a vast array of opportunities ranging from Nursing, Clinical, to Finance, IT, Administrative, Research and Support Services to name a few. Across all locations, you’ll find career opportunities that support diversity, equity and inclusion. At Mayo Clinic, we invest in you with opportunities for growth and development and our benefits and compensation package are highly competitive. We invite you to be a part of our team where you’ll discover a culture of teamwork, professionalism, mutual respect, and most importantly, a life-changing career!

Mayo Clinic offers a variety of employee benefits. For additional information please visit Mayo Clinic Benefits. Eligibility may vary.


Understands and considers both the business and the technical engineering/IT needs to ensure quality digital products and related operational workflows to meet/exceed the desired business objectives. Able to perform cost, benefit and risk analysis associated with the proposed product/services and recommend alternatives for solutions throughout the product life cycle. Collaborates with stakeholders and users to synthesize, articulate, and document business and system requirements. Performs data analysis, defines, and documents business requirements, translates business requirements to technical/engineering specifications, acceptance criteria, user experience requirements and system validation while considering the complete technical and non-technical solution. Technical specifications are utilized by Engineering/IT in the final technical design and eventual product build/acquisition or integration. May assist product and operations leaders to coordinate deployment of deliverables (varies by product). Provides input for development of other product documents, project charters and plans, work assignments, deliverable target dates, and other aspects of assigned work. Applies systems engineering methodologies and discipline throughout the product and project lifecycle based on assignment. Recruits, hires, and manages team. Drives BA best practices through training, mentorship, and skill development of team members. Researches, analyzes and validates complete and accurate business and systems requirements. Establishes scope boundaries for basic and routine products and technical requirements with accuracy and clarity. Plans and monitors work scope estimates and schedules for the defined scope of the product. Assesses and defines problems through root cause analysis and proactively brings solutions to the table. Able to read, assess and interpret vended and solution architecture and translate into scope of work and technical specification requirements for integration into Mayo Clinic engineering/technology systems and product operations workflows. Understands and helps define product implementation change management requirements for those products not requiring formal Implementation Team resourcing. Demonstrated experience leading teams in Product Owner and/or Scrum Master capacity. Proven experience leading requirements definition and use case to usability red and blue-line wireframes, comps and business rules for digital applications as a service. Proven experience in cross-functional team leadership, serving as Product Manager and/or Scrum Master on daily stand-ups, spring planning, retrospectives and demos.



CDH2021


Bachelor's Degree (business, communications, advertising, marketing, statistics, engineering, technology, health care) and 7+ years of relevant digital business analyst role.


Business Analyst Activities for New Product Development
Previous Healthcare and Agile experience preferred.
Understand business strategy and business planning principles and applies with minimal guidance to assigned work. Demonstrated leadership and expertise in design, build and operations capabilities and requirements of current digital product technologies. Able to understand and effectively communicate overarching product strategy to provide context to technical requirements and specifications. Able to understand and effectively document business, operational and technical requirements for product, operations, and engineering/IT teams. Able to document technical requirements and specifications in the chosen BA requirements tool(s). Applies system and analytical thinking methodology and discipline. Ability to build and maintain strong working relationships at multiple levels of the organization. Effective (or Strong) communicator (written & verbal) with active listening skills. Ability to facilitate small group/team discussions. Professional and reflects Mayo Clinic values and beliefs. Strong planning & organizational skills. Proactive and able to navigate conflict and help find resolution. Problem solver with ability to maintain a keen attention to detail and manage multiple initiatives.


Certification in Scrum Product Owner within 1 year


Exempt


$115,918 - $168,085/ year


Yes


Full Time


80


Monday - Friday 8:00 - 5:00. May need to be flexible with clinical schedules and new product launches/releases. 100% remote role, the employee can work anywhere in the U.S.


Need to be flexible for periodic new product launches and releases.


Yes


No


Mayo Clinic is located in the heart of downtown Rochester, Minnesota, a vibrant, friendly city that provides a highly livable environment for more than 34,000 Mayo staff and students. The city is consistently ranked among the best places to live in the United States because of its affordable cost of living, healthy lifestyle, excellent school systems and exceptionally high quality of life.


Laura Percival


As an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer Mayo Clinic is committed to creating an inclusive environment that values the diversity of its employees and does not discriminate against any employee or candidate. Women, minorities, veterans, people from the LGBTQ communities and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply to join our teams. Reasonable accommodations to access job openings or to apply for a job are available.

Who we are:
Mozart Data automates most of the work data engineers and data scientists traditionally do to spin up and run a modern data stack. We are looking for a customer facing data expert to work closely with our most active users to support them in getting the most out of Mozart Data.

Title: Operations Analytics and Data Execution Lead
Job_Description:
Job Description: Data Analyst

Why Guaranteed Rate is the BEST Place to Work

Guaranteed Rate is one of the largest retail mortgage lenders in the United States. Headquartered in Chicago, the Company has 7,500 employees in 400 offices across the U.S., and is licensed in all 50 states and Washington, D.C. Since its founding in 2000, Guaranteed Rate has helped hundreds of thousands of homeowners with home purchase loans and refinances and funded more than $59 billion in loans in 2020 alone. The company has cemented itself as Positively Different by introducing innovative technology, such as the world's first Digital Mortgage, by offering low rates and by delivering unparalleled customer service. Honors and awards include: Top Lender for Online Service for 2018 by U.S. News & World Report; Best Mortgage Lender for Online Loans and Best Mortgage Lender for Refinancing by NerdWallet for 2021; HousingWire’s 2020 Tech100 award for the company’s industry-leading FlashClose SM technology; No. 3 ranking in Scotsman Guide's Top Retail Mortgage Lenders 2019; Chicago Agent Magazine’s Lender of the Year for five consecutive years; Chicago Tribune's Top Workplaces list for seven consecutive years. Visit rate.com for more information.

What Makes Our Team Awesome

We are a gritty group of passionate technologists on a mission to dominate the mortgage world!

The Information Technology Team within Guaranteed Rate passionately and consistently puts our customers first. We are building the latest technology to help create the best mortgage experience on the planet and get your mortgage, your way, anytime, anywhere. Whether that is improving our digital mortgage platform, automating loan coordination and underwriting processes, or building out the latest marketing and customer engagement platform, we’re doing it all. We build high performing, self-organized, cross functional agile teams that operate with minimal hierarchy. Information Technology team members hold self and others accountable and live and breathe the tenets of autonomy, mastery and purpose.

Who You Are

The Data Analyst will have a diverse set of responsibilities supporting the design / build of data platforms that enable revenue generation, operational execution, reporting, strategic analysis and next generation Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning. You will have the opportunity to leverage your data analysis and design skills to help Guaranteed Rate deliver upon the organization’s Data Strategy and Data Management Program. You will work cross-functionally across departments and enhance existing data platforms and build new information infrastructure that helps the business uncover insights, make clear visualizations, tell compelling stories, and drive action and outcomes. The ideal candidate is action-oriented and leverages their experience and academic training to pragmatically tackle complex data problems, including addressing regulatory obligations. The Guaranteed Rate Data Office engages with a diverse array of stakeholders including both business and technology teams. The Data Analyst will deliver data platforms that help the organization realize data-driven decisions and operational optimization.

What You Do

Analyze customer data to develop actionable insights to drive customer behavior and operational efficiencies

Partner with Technology and Data Engineering resources to design, build and implement data platforms in support of analytics, reporting, marketing, operations, etc.

Conduct root-cause data analysis to identify patterns and trends

Explain data anomalies, develop data visualizations and reporting to drive key messaging and recommendations

Deliver data-centric process improvement both individual teams and cross-organization / multi-stakeholder projects

Assists delivering the design, development, and maintenance of databases, data marts and dashboard tools; Orchestrates data quality / integrity improvements for critical data elements

Support strategic projects related to new product deployment and customer-level aggregation deliverables

Support Marketing data extracts, campaign execution including segmentation analysis. Provide observations and business context to deliver meaningful insights to business leads related to campaigns/offers

What Makes You a Perfect Fit

4+ years of progressive professional work experience building data platforms; expertise supporting/executing reporting & analytics, including working in teams of data analytic resources

Experience and a working understanding of data profiling tooling and data analysis methodologies to understand data quality and identify data concerns

Expertise with campaign execution tools and business processes, including data integration and data extraction processes

Advanced understanding and proven experience using data management concepts, data normalization and ETL development

Experienced building presentations with actionable insights

Strong verbal and visual communication skills to present and explain data strategies, data deliverables and data analytic insights

Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

Proven experience with on premise and cloud-based data solutions (SQL Server, Azure, AWS, GCP, Snowflake), data modeling, metadata management, database design/build/implementation/management and data visualization tools/platforms

Sound understanding of data governance concepts

Hands on experience with SQL, Python, or R

Other Useful Details

Employee Type
Full-Time

Pay Range
80,000-100,000+ Bonus and/or Commissions

Location
Remote or Chicago-based

Job_Description:
At Trane TechnologiesTM and through our businesses including Trane® and Thermo King®, we create innovative climate solutions for buildings, homes, and transportation that challenge what’s possible for a sustainable world. We're a team that dares to look at the world's challenges and see impactful possibilities. We believe in a better future when we uplift others and enable our people to thrive at work and at home. We boldly go.
Data Privacy Analyst Job Description
Trane Technologies is seeking an Analyst to support the strategic priorities and mitigation of privacy risks across its global entities. This role will primarily support the operational processes in evaluating technologies and processes for privacy risks, as well as participate in key strategic priorities of the Global Privacy function. The successful candidate will be expected to quickly build subject matter expertise in privacy regulations and policies while providing impactful contributions to evaluating technologies and the operational risks and impacts regarding privacy compliance.

Job Description
Responsible for working closely with management to execute analytical initiatives. Responsible for solving business problems by leveraging techniques such as segmentation, optimization, advanced analytics and machine learning. Creates reports and dashboards to closely monitor performance metrics and provide insights. Title: Operations Analytics and Data Execution Lead
Operations Analytics and Data Execution Lead
Job_Description:
As a Data Analyst you are responsible for leveraging multiple data sources to provide analytics to evaluate key activities and trends that are impacting the business and transform the data into insights. You will deliver strategic and consultative recommendations to help guide data-informed decision making and develop more effective retail strategies and plans.
What will you do?
* Leverages existing systems and field data to provide retail analytics on the state of the business
* Provides in-depth data analysis of strengths/weaknesses in current execution of retail strategies
* Develops comprehensive and clear understanding of retail environments and consumer insights to utilize when recommending effective in-market strategies
* Leverages analytics to develop solid Key Performance Indicator (KPI) strategies for field execution and/or account management
* Serves as a point of influence for the client and effectively communicates performance measurements and impact of initiatives
* Statistical analysis of results to identify impact of initiatives
* Leverages data available, identifies opportunities and potential and likely outcomes from putting recommendations into action
* Compiles data into professional reports that support both findings and recommendations
* Clearly communicates and articulates compelling business insights and actions with data and context
* Presents data to client and all levels of management and gains buy-in based on credibility of analytics
* Manages multiple analytics requests that come from a variety of sources, at varying times, with varying beginning and end dates
* Communicates via assigned methods (verbal, written, formal presentation) all assigned reports by assigned due dates

Title: Operations Analytics and Data Execution Lead
Job_Description:
Role Description At Dropbox, our leaders, our People team, and our business stakeholders understand the power of using data to shape our HR and Recruiting strategies.
Our People Analytics team has made significant investments in our data warehouse and infrastructure, and we ve launched a suite of HR and Recruiting dashboards to empower our internal customers.
Now, we re looking for someone to take our self-service dashboarding capabilities to the next level through world-class visualizations, proactive alerts, enhanced performance, and multi-data source metrics.
You bring the ability to take a holistic approach to the wide-variety of People data needs across Dropbox.
You re able to balance multiple priorities, deep analytical rigor, and excellent interpersonal skills that can be tailored to cross-functional audiences at every level.
You also love what you do, possess a positive, let s make it work mindset, and can thrive under pressure.
Responsibilities Lead Tableau dashboard development efforts within Dropbox s People Analytics team, specifically focused on Recruiting dashboards Partner with stakeholders across Dropbox to understand data needs, define solutions, and visualize a wide variety of Recruiting & HR metrics Develop prototypes, mock-ups, and conceptualization of ideas that bring simplicity and context to complex design challenges Build analytics capabilities through data literacy trainings focused on storytelling with data, and leveraging dashboards to take action Leverage and improve upon our internal data warehouse through partnership with other technical teams at Dropbox and external consultants Develop, consolidate, and improve our self-service HR and Recruiting dashboards based on user feedback Requirements 3-5 years of experience building data visualizations in Tableau with a portfolio of intuitive, interactive dashboards Expertise in leveraging complex data sources to visually represent business metrics Ability to quickly prototype and transform ideas into high-quality work product Strong communication skills and ability to articulate complex solutions well to both technical and non-technical audiences Low ego attitude with a willingness to shift from high-level critical thinking to stepping in and helping to drive implementation alongside functional teams Knowledge of HR and Recruiting processes Preferred Qualifications 5+ years of experience in dashboard development and data visualizations 2+ years of experience working in the HR/Recruiting space 2+ years of experience in enterprise data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake) 2+ years of experience managing and analyzing structured and unstructured data using SQL, R, and/or Python Experience working in an agile development environment Total Rewards For candidates hired in Colorado, the expected salary/On-Target Earnings (OTE) range for the role is $99,300 - $116,800 - $134,300.
This salary/OTE range represents the low, middle, and high end of the salary or OTE (Sales roles) range for this position, and is subject to change.
To determine a Dropboxer s starting pay we carefully consider a variety of factors, including primary work location and an evaluation of a candidate s skills, experience, market demands, and internal parity.
This position may be considered a promotional opportunity.
Salary/OTE is just one component of Dropbox s total rewards package.
All regular employees are also eligible for the corporate bonus program or a sales incentive (target included in OTE) as well as stock in the form of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs).
Dropbox is committed to investing in the holistic health and wellbeing of all Dropboxers and their families.
Our benefits and perks programs include, but are not limited to: Competitive medical, dental and vision coverage (US Only) Competitive 401(k) Plan with a generous company match and immediate vesting Flexible Time Off/Paid Time Off, paid holidays, 11 Company-wide PTO days, Volunteer time off and more Protection Plans including; Life Insurance, Disability Insurance and Travel benefit plans Perks Allowance to be used on what matters most to you, whether that s wellness, learning and development, food & groceries, and much more Parental benefits including; Parental Leave, Child and Adult Care, Day Care FSA (US Only), Fertility Benefits (US Only), Adoption and Surrogacy support and Lactation Support Mental Health and Wellness benefits Free Dropbox space for your friends and family Additional benefits details are available upon request.
Dropbox is in the process of updating our technology to provide pay ranges in New York City based on the recent amendments to the New York City Human Rights Law (NYCHRL).
If you are based in NYC and have any questions about the pay range for this role, please contact paytransparency@ and provide your name and the job title to which you are interested in applying.

Title: Operations Analytics and Data Execution Lead
Job_Description:
Purpose of Job We are seeking a talented Business Support Analyst II, to join our Team. This individual will work Remote.

This position supports and enables the business by analyzing and evaluating relevant routine business data, information, metrics, and process to identify opportunities and solutions to business plan development and optimization of business operations. Responsible for supporting key functions and providing recommendations to achieve current and future business strategy needs/objectives.

Job Requirements
About USAA

USAA knows what it means to serve. We facilitate the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. This singular mission requires a dedication to innovative thinking at every level.


Identifies and manages existing and emerging risks that stem from business activities and the job role.

Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled.

Follows written risk and compliance policies, standards, and procedures for business activities.

Provides operational support on current processes and supports business operations and management in identifying opportunities and solutions to meet current and future business needs.

Organizes and defines parameters of assigned projects and assembles relevant data for said project(s).

Validates information and interfaces with other departments to include presentations of documented findings, alternatives, and recommended actions.

Gathers information, analyzes data, and trends, identifies root causes, and develops recommendations to improve business operations.

Reviews, validates, and/or analyzes reports that function as a control to existing processes.


OR 4 years of related experience (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree (6yrs total experience in lieu of a degree).

2 years of business support experience in an analyst capacity supporting business planning initiatives and/or operations experience, including: requirement gathering and documentation, operational planning and forecasting, data analytics, or current/future state analysis, in direct support of business planning initiatives and optimization of business operations.

Proficient level experience in a wide variety of systems coordination, process/product review initiatives and the development of management information requirements for related business functions.


State filing experience

Commercial lines insurance experience

Technical skills including proficiency in excel, experience with SharePoint

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.


USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market position. The salary range for this position is: $54,800 - $98,700.
Employees may be eligible for pay incentives based on overall corporate and individual performance or at the discretion of the USAA Board of Directors.
Shift premium will be addressed on an individual basis for applicable roles that are consistently scheduled for non-core hours.


At USAA our employees enjoy best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellness. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k), pension, life insurance, parental benefits, adoption assistance, paid time off program with paid holidays plus 16 paid volunteer hours, and various wellness programs. Additionally, our career path planning, and continuing education assists employees with their professional goals.

To see details on our outstanding benefits, visit USAA Total Rewards.

Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

USAA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Operations Analytics and Data Execution Lead
Job_Description:
The Field Enablement and Analytics team within GRS Field Operations is seeking a Senior Business Analyst to provide robust analysis and actionable insights in support of our Global Private Equity leadership and directors.
We are seeking an energetic, driven analyst with creative problem-solving ability who will thrive in a fast-pace and complex data environment. In addition to direct analytic support of our Private Equity Team, the Sr Business Analyst will be expected to support various aspects of our internal private equity data processes (i.e. partnering with multiple parts of the organization to report on and analyze metrics, strategies, and opportunities with a global lens), and drive analyses in partnership with our stakeholders in an effort to keep us ahead of our competition. The Sr Business Analyst will also be involved in the development of presentation materials and data packets in support of various executive meetings.
The ideal candidate must be a strong collaborator and be able to work with general direction from manager on more complex tasks.

Title: Operations Analytics and Data Execution Lead
Job_Description:
ECS is seeking a Jr. Data Analyst to work Remote.
Job Description:
ECS seeks a Data Analyst (Junior) to support VHA in the analysis and evaluation of service and program information drawn from its Corporate Data Warehouse (CDW). This includes developing and executing SQL queries to extract target information and systematic analysis to identify virtual care episodes and quantify cost and other metrics including measuring outcomes and improvement. The Data Analyst will also be responsible for creating deliverables, including but not limited to briefings and documents that speak to project-related topics, e.g., metrics, measures, data themes and gaps.
This is a full-time position (40 hours per week). Work is 100% remote.

Title: Operations Analytics and Data Execution Lead
Job_Description:
We are looking for a SQL Developer/Data Analyst to work for a leader in our utility industry. We need this individual to be attentive to detail, willing to hit ground running and be a go-getter. We also need this person to come up with solutions and ideas on how we can be better.

-5+ years of Data Analytics / Development experience
- Experience building and troubleshooting SQL Databases (would prefer experience on the database side and SQL Developer rather than just building visualizations - understands IT tools integrations, data pipelines)
